meanings.definition: The act or process of forming a mental image or vision.
meanings.sent1: She closed her eyes and used visualisation to imagine herself on a sandy beach.
meanings.sent2: The artist's visualisation of the sunset was breathtaking.
meanings.sent3: During the boring lecture, he entertained himself by visualising a dancing elephant.
meanings.sent4: Her visualisation of success was like a bright beacon guiding her forward.
meanings.sent5: Through visualisation, he could see every detail of the mysterious castle in his mind.

meanings.definition: The representation of an object or situation in a visual form.
meanings.sent1: The visualisation of the new building project helped the team understand the design better.
meanings.sent2: The infographic provided a clear visualisation of the data trends.
meanings.sent3: The visualisation of the alien invasion in the movie was both thrilling and terrifying.
meanings.sent4: Her visualisation of the problem as a tangled knot helped her unravel the solution.
meanings.sent5: The visualisation of the solar system made it easier for the students to grasp the concept.

meanings.definition: The practice of creating visual images to aid in understanding or problem-solving.
meanings.sent1: The visualisation of complex data sets made it easier for the team to analyze the information.
meanings.sent2: Using visualisation techniques, she was able to come up with innovative solutions.
meanings.sent3: The visualisation of the math problem as a colorful puzzle made it more fun to solve.
meanings.sent4: His visualisation of the project timeline as a road map helped him stay on track.
meanings.sent5: Through visualisation, she could see the connections between different concepts clearly.
